title: Anwar emphasises need for transparency in managing funds for charity
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has emphasised the need for transparency in managing funds raised for charity in the country.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 17): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has emphasised the need for transparency in managing funds raised for charity in the country.

Anwar, who is also the finance minister, said organisations must adhere to regulations when raising funds to ensure they are channelled to the target groups.

He said the Madani government always prioritises financial management with an emphasis on proper governance to prevent funds from being misused by irre

title: Malaysia on right path to gain MSPO recognition from EU, says Fadillah
summary: Malaysia is on the right track to obtain the European Union’s (EU) green light in the near term for the recognition of the Malaysian Sustainable Palm Oil (MSPO) certification scheme, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof.
content:
KUCHING (Feb 17): Malaysia is on the right track to obtain the European Union’s (EU) green light in the near term for the recognition of the Malaysian Sustainable Palm Oil (MSPO) certification scheme, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof.

Fadillah, who is also the energy transition and water transformation minister, said the EU leadership is expected to make the announcement by June at the latest.

“We want MSPO to be recognise

title: Rapid Rail targets 200,000 LRT users daily on Ampang-Sri Petaling Line by end-2024
summary: Rapid Rail Sdn Bhd is targeting a daily average of 200,000 Light Rail Transit (LRT) users on the Ampang/Sri Petaling Line by the end of 2024.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 17): Rapid Rail Sdn Bhd is targeting a daily average of 200,000 Light Rail Transit (LRT) users on the Ampang/Sri Petaling Line by the end of 2024.

Rapid Rail said on Saturday that the projection compares with 155,000 passengers last year, following the reopening of the route between the Masjid Jamek Station and the Bandaraya Station at 6am on Saturday.

“Simultaneously with the reopening of the route between the two stations, the frequency of tr

title: MACC extends deadline for Dr M’s son to declare assets
summary: Anti-graft officials have granted one of former prime minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad’s sons more time to declare his wealth, amid an investigation into his business activities.
content:
(Feb 17): Anti-graft officials have granted one of former prime minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad’s sons more time to declare his wealth, amid an investigation into his business activities.

Tan Sri Mirzan Mahathir was initially told on Jan 18 to declare all his assets within 30 days. Failure to do so could have seen him charged in court, which happened to Mahathir’s former adviser last month.

“We are giving him the extension after he appl

title: Armizan: GRS-PH unity must continue in next Sabah polls
summary: Gabungan Rakyat Sabah (GRS) deputy secretary general Datuk Armizan Mohd Ali wants the existing unity between the coalition and Pakatan Harapan (PH) to continue in the next Sabah election.
content:
KOTA KINABALU (Feb 17): Gabungan Rakyat Sabah (GRS) deputy secretary general Datuk Armizan Mohd Ali wants the existing unity between the coalition and Pakatan Harapan (PH) to continue in the next Sabah election.

The Papar Member of Parliament said although the top leadership of GRS had not yet discussed any collaboration formula for the polls, he had his views on the matter.

“Sabah and Sarawak have their own formulas where in essence, th

title: Chow says MAHB staff quarters relocation issue resolved for Penang airport expansion
summary: The Penang government has resolved the relocation issue for over 50 Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB) staff affected by the Penang International Airport expansion project.
content:
BUKIT MERTAJAM (Feb 17): The Penang government has resolved the relocation issue for over 50 Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB) staff affected by the Penang International Airport expansion project. 

Chief Minister Chow Kon Yeow stated that the relocation involved those residing in quarters, who were offered affordable homes in Teluk Kumbar.

“The state government's role is limited, because the [expansion] project is managed by MAHB.

title: Ammonia gas leak: 18 victims including two pregnant women admitted to hospitals
summary: The Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed that 18 victims are being treated at three hospitals in the Klang Valley following a gas leak incident at a factory in Perindustrian Bukit Raja, Section 7, Shah Alam on Friday.
content:
CYBERJAYA (Feb 17): The Ministry of Health (MOH) has confirmed that 18 victims are being treated at three hospitals in the Klang Valley following a gas leak incident at a factory in Perindustrian Bukit Raja, Section 7, Shah Alam on Friday.

Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Dzulkefly Ahmad said that 10 victims were admitted to the Shah Alam Hospital, five others to the Tengku Ampuan Rahimah Hospital, and three to the Sungai Buloh Hospital.

"They are in stab

title: Campus View: Overcoming hurdles to the widespread adoption of Islamic finance
summary: Shariah-compliant practices in Islamic finance draw upon principles outlined in Islamic law (shariah). The key principles include the prohibition of interest (riba), avoidance of excessive uncertainty (gharar) and speculation (maisir), and ensuring that transactions are based on underlying tangible assets or services. To ensure compliance, Islamic finance institutions often consult shariah scholars and establish shariah supervisory boards to provide guidance and ensure that transactions align with these principles.
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on February 12, 2024 - February 18, 2024

Shariah-compliant practices in Islamic finance draw upon principles outlined in Islamic law (shariah). The key principles include the prohibition of interest (riba), avoidance of excessive uncertainty (gharar) and speculation (maisir), and ensuring that transactions are based on underlying tangible assets or services. title: Loke: Prasarana to seek RM38m compensation for LRT disruption
summary: Prasarana Malaysia Bhd will take legal action against the developer and site owner of a hotel project allegedly responsible for disruptions to the Light Rail Transit (LRT) operations between the Masjid Jamek and Bandaraya stations here, including seeking compensation of RM38 million.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 17): Prasarana Malaysia Bhd will take legal action against the developer and site owner of a hotel project allegedly responsible for disruptions to the Light Rail Transit (LRT) operations between the Masjid Jamek and Bandaraya stations here, including seeking compensation of RM38 million.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke Siew Fook said the amount includes the cost of structural repairs and operational costs of contingency plans, such as providing shuttle buses.

title: My Say: Lessons from Singapore’s experience with the Progressive Wage Model
summary: Following Minister of Economy Rafizi Ramli’s comment that Malaysia was studying Singapore’s Progressive Wage Model (PWM), the government released a white paper last November that outlined a pilot PWM. The PWM as envisioned by Rafizi will coexist with the national minimum wage, which stands at RM1,500 per month, with an exemption for micro firms with fewer than five employees.
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on February 12, 2024 - February 18, 2024

Following Minister of Economy Rafizi Ramli’s comment that Malaysia was studying Singapore’s Progressive Wage Model (PWM), the government released a white paper last November that outlined a pilot PWM. title: Govt yet to decide on single-grade white rice — minister
summary:
The government has yet to decide on introducing a single grade of white rice known as the Malaysia Madani white rice.

Agriculture and Food Security Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Sabu said any announcement or decision made must be in accordance with the Control of Padi and Rice Act 1994 (Act 522), and be communicated to the Cabinet.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 17): The government has yet to decide on introducing a single grade of white rice known as the Malaysia Madani white rice.

Agriculture and Food Security Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Sabu said any announcement or decision made must be in accordance with the Control of Padi and Rice Act 1994 (Act 522), and be communicated to the Cabinet.

title: Foreign funds expected to boost Bursa in coming week
summary: The return of foreign funds to the region is expected to provide a fillip to Bursa Malaysia next week, as buying momentum for domestic equities persists on renewed optimism.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 17): The return of foreign funds to the region is expected to provide a fillip to Bursa Malaysia next week, as buying momentum for domestic equities persists on renewed optimism.

Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said the brokerage firm remains hopeful that the current momentum would lift the trading volume and draw in more investors into the market, especially retail investors.

“As such, we

title: Ringgit seen remaining soft at 4.76-4.77 against US dollar next week
summary: The ringgit is expected to remain soft next week, with a possible range of around 4.76 to 4.77 against the US dollar, said an analyst.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 17): The ringgit is expected to remain soft next week, with a possible range of around 4.76 to 4.77 against the US dollar, said an analyst. 

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the ringgit was generally on the weaker bias, given that the US economy was fairly robust relative to its Group of Seven peers.

Hence, the US dollar would likely be in high demand, he told Bernama.

title: Apex Equity addresses lingering questions
summary: One of the smaller brokerages in a highly competitive stockbroking industry, the boardroom and shareholding changes in Apex Equity Holdings Bhd in the last five years have grossly overshadowed its history, where it displayed tenacity to remain in business even in the worst of times.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 17): One of the smaller brokerages in a highly competitive stockbroking industry, the boardroom and shareholding changes in Apex Equity Holdings Bhd in the last five years have grossly overshadowed its history, where it displayed tenacity to remain in business even in the worst of times.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Nvidia earnings could test US market’s AI dreams
summary: Next week’s earnings report from chipmaker Nvidia could prove a gut check for one of the market’s hottest names, and for the artificial intelligence fever that has helped power gains for US stocks in recent months.
content:

title: Oil records weekly gain on Middle East tensions
summary: Oil prices settled higher on Friday as geopolitical tensions in the Middle East more than offset a forecast from the International Energy Agency for slowing demand.
content:
Brent crude futures settled up 61 cents, or 0.74% at US$83.47 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude settled US$1.16, or 1.49%, higher at US$79.19.

NEW YORK: Oil prices settled higher on Friday as geopolitical tensions in the Middle East more than offset a forecast from the International Energy Agency for slowing demand.

title: Wall St slides as hot producer price data crimps rate cut bets
summary: US stocks fell on Friday with the Nasdaq showing the largest decline after a hotter-than-expected producer prices report eroded hopes for imminent interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.
content:
The S&P 500 lost 24.18 points, or 0.49%, to end at 5,005.15 points, while the Nasdaq lost 132.38 points, or 0.83%, to 15,775.65. The Dow fell 149.48 points, or 0.39%, to 38,623.64.

NEW YORK: US stocks fell on Friday with the Nasdaq showing the largest decline after a hotter-than-expected producer prices report eroded hopes for imminent interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.

title: Socso paid RM5.73 billion in benefits last year — Sim
summary:
The Social Security Organisation (Socso) made benefit payments of up to RM5.73 bil to Insured Persons (IPs) and their dependents last year, said Human Resources Minister Steven Sim Chee Keong.

He said that the agency made similar payments of RM5.1 billion in 2022 and Socso’s overall financial performance in 2023 was the best since Socso was established in 1971.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Feb 16): The Social Security Organisation (Socso) made benefit payments of up to RM5.73 bil to Insured Persons (IPs) and their dependents last year, said Human Resources Minister Steven Sim Chee Keong.

He said that the agency made similar payments of RM5.1 billion in 2022 and Socso’s overall financial performance in 2023 was the best since Socso was established in 1971.

“This success can be attributed to Socso's financial performance ended last year

title: Govt to set up 186 more PEDi to bridge digital divide — PM
summary:
The Madani government will add 186 new Digital Economic Centres (PEDi), bringing the total to 1,097  nationwide by the end of this year, Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said.

He said there are currently 911 PEDi, and the effort to add more such centres, especially in areas often overlooked, is the government's initiative to address the digital and income gap, while adding that digital transformation is a crucial agenda in realising the vision of the Madani Economic Framework.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 12): The Madani government will add 186 new Digital Economic Centres (PEDi), bringing the total to 1,097  nationwide by the end of this year, Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said.

He said there are currently 911 PEDi, and the effort to add more such centres, especially in areas often overlooked, is the government's initiative to address the digital and income gap, while adding that digital transformation is a crucial agenda in realising the vision of the Madani Economic Framework

title: KPJ, BHIC, MRCB, KNM, SNS Network, ICT Zone Asia and MyEG
summary:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 16): Here is a brief recap of the corporate announcements that made the news on Friday:

KPJ Healthcare Bhd's net profit rose nearly 16% in the fourth quarter ended Dec 31, 2023 from a year earlier thanks to higher patient numbers and tax writeback. Net profit for the q...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Feb 16): Here is a brief recap of the corporate announcements that made the news on Friday:

KPJ Healthcare Bhd's net profit rose nearly 16% in the fourth quarter ended Dec 31, 2023 from a year earlier thanks to higher patient numbers and tax writeback. Net profit for the quarter was RM73.39 million compared with RM63.41 million. Revenue rose 19% year-on-year to RM911.5 million from RM765.8 million as patient numbers gained 4%. The company declared a single-tier interim dividend of 1 sen per share

title: Italy’s small investor push to slacken when ECB rate cuts start
summary: Elisabetta Trevisan, a 50-year-old teacher from Venice, plans to use interest payments from an Italian bond for small savers to help put her two sons through university.
content:
Small savers are attracted by the low tax rate of 12.5% on income from Italian bonds, half that for other financial assets. — Reuters

ELISABETTA Trevisan, a 50-year-old teacher from Venice, plans to use interest payments from an Italian bond for small savers to help put her two sons through university.

title: BoJ keeps April policy shift on table
summary: The Bank of Japan (BoJ) is on track to end negative interest rates in the coming months despite the economy’s fall into recession, say sources familiar with its thinking, though weak domestic demand means they may seek more clues on wages growth before acting.
content:

title: KWAP pumps RM100mil into startups, VC funds
summary: Retirement Fund Inc (KWAP) is investing a total of RM100mil in two Malaysian startups and two venture capital (VC) funds as part of its investments under its Dana Perintis strategy.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Retirement Fund Inc (KWAP) is investing a total of RM100mil in two Malaysian startups and two venture capital (VC) funds as part of its investments under its Dana Perintis strategy.

The retirement fund invested an undisclosed monies into startups Bateriku (M) Sdn Bhd and Lapasar Sdn Bhd to support their growth and expansion plans, KWAP said in a statement.

content:

title: Growth in 2023 moderates to 3.7%
summary: Slower global trade, the global tech downcycle, geopolitical tensions and tighter monetary policies globally had weighed on Malaysia’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth for the fourth quarter of 2023.
content:
SLOWER global trade, the global tech downcycle, geopolitical tensions and tighter monetary policies globally had weighed on Malaysia’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth for the fourth quarter of 2023.

The quarter’s GDP growth at 3% came in lower than the 3.4% advance projection released last month, and compared with the 3.3% expansion in the preceding quarter, according to Bank Negara.

title: The global south needs a leader. Why not Indonesia?
summary: Over the past decade, the world’s least obtrusive populist quietly built a case for Indonesia as not just an attractive investment destination but a leader of the developing world. Now, President Joko Widodo’s onetime rival-turned-handpicked successor, Prabowo Subianto, has a chance to fulfill those grand aspirations.

title: New gameplan key to staying relevant
summary: In recent decades, investments have taken a backseat in the Malaysian economy, as the country becomes more consumption-driven.
content:
IN recent decades, investments have taken a backseat in the Malaysian economy, as the country becomes more consumption-driven.

From 40% of the gross domestic product (GDP) in the mid-1990s, the share of investments has fallen since the 1997 financial crisis to around 20% currently.
